Get licensed to drive hackney carriages or private hire vehicles in Gloucester

Current processing times: Due to high application volumes, please allow 20 working days before enquiring about your application. We aim to process most applications within 14 days.

üöï Hackney Carriage vs Private Hire

üöï Hackney Carriage

  • Can be hailed in the street
  • Can wait at ranks
  • Pre-booking accepted
  • Display 'TAXI' signage

üöó Private Hire

  • Must be pre-booked only
  • Cannot be hailed in street
  • Cannot wait at ranks
  • No 'TAXI' or 'CAB' signage

üí° Good to know

Dual licence: Many drivers hold both hackney carriage AND private hire licences for maximum flexibility. You can drive either type of vehicle depending on which licence you hold.

üÜï New Application

First time applying for a taxi driver licence in Gloucester? Here's everything you need to know.

Typical Cost
¬£400-¬£600+
Before application fees
Timeline
6-12 weeks
If all tests passed first time
Licence Duration
3 years
Then renewable

Basic requirements

  • 21 years or over
  • Full DVLA driving licence held for at least 12 continuous months
  • No more than 3 current penalty points on DVLA licence
  • Legal right to work in UK (Immigration Act 2016)
  • Must pass fit and proper person test

Step-by-step application process

Follow these steps in order. Each step must be completed before you can apply.

Step 1: English Language Test ¬£45
üéØ
DO THIS FIRST! You must pass this before doing any other tests. No point spending money on other tests if you cannot pass the English test.

What it is: A proficiency test to ensure you can communicate clearly with passengers in English.

How to book: Call the licensing team on 01452 396396

Cost: ¬£45

Step 2: Medical Examination ¬£50-¬£150

Standard required: DVLA Group 2 (same as HGV/bus drivers)

Who can do it: Your GP or registered medical practitioner

Important: Must use council-approved medical form and be no more than 3 months old when submitted

Cost: Varies by GP - typically ¬£50-¬£150

Future renewals:

  • Every 5 years if under 65
  • Annually if over 65
Step 3: Enhanced DBS Check ¬£50-¬£60

Level: Enhanced disclosure including barred lists

Apply through: TaxiPlus online system

Apply for DBS check ‚Üí

‚ö†Ô∏è
CRITICAL: You MUST subscribe to the DBS Update Service within 28 days of receiving your certificate. Cost: ¬£13/year. This is a licence condition.
Step 4: Driving Assessment ¬£100-¬£150

What it tests: Your ability to drive safely with passengers, anticipate hazards, and follow best practice

Approved providers:

  • Diamond Advanced Tests (IAM RoadSmart)
  • The Blue Lamp Trust
  • Green Penny

Cost: Typically ¬£100-¬£150 depending on provider

Step 5: Knowledge Test

For Hackney Carriage: Topographical knowledge test covering Gloucester city and surrounding areas. You'll need to know streets, landmarks, and routes.

For Private Hire: Literacy and numeracy test (Private Hire Knowledge Test)

How to book: Call 01452 396396 to arrange payment, then licensing will contact you to schedule the test

Retakes: You can retake up to 2 times within 12 months. If you fail 3 times, you cannot retake until you can demonstrate further learning has taken place.

Step 6: Safeguarding Training Free

Requirement: Mandatory for all new applicants

What's covered:

  • Recognising signs of abuse
  • Child sexual exploitation (CSE)
  • Modern slavery and trafficking
  • How to report concerns

How to book: Check the council website for upcoming course dates and venues

You'll receive a certificate upon completion which must be submitted with your application.

Step 7: Certificate of Good Conduct (if applicable)

Who needs this?

Only required if you have lived outside the UK for more than 3 months since age 18

Obtain from: Embassy or consulate of each country you've lived in

Important: This can take several months to obtain from some countries - start this process early!

Step 8: Submit Your Application

You'll need all of the following:

  • English language test pass certificate
  • Medical certificate (less than 3 months old)
  • Enhanced DBS certificate with Update Service subscription
  • Certificate of good conduct (if applicable)
  • Driving assessment pass certificate
  • Knowledge test pass certificate
  • Safeguarding training certificate
  • Proof of right to work in UK
  • DVLA driving licence
  • Proof of address

Application fee: Must be paid in full when submitting - see fees and charges

Apply online via My Gloucester ‚Üí

What happens after you apply?

  1. Application review (1-2 weeks)

    The licensing team will review all your documents and certificates

  2. NR3 database check (automatic)

    Council checks the National Register of Refusals and Revocations to ensure you haven't been refused or had a licence revoked elsewhere

  3. Fit and proper person assessment

    Licensing officer assesses whether you meet the "fit and proper" test based on character, convictions, behaviour, and compliance with regulations

  4. Decision (usually within 14 days)

    You'll be notified by email or letter. If approved, you can collect your badge from the licensing office

  5. Start driving!

    Once you have your badge, you can start work. You must display your badge while driving and carry it at all times when working

üîÑ Renewal

Already licensed? Here's what you need to renew your driver licence.

‚è∞
Renew before expiry! You cannot legally operate as a taxi driver if your licence has expired. Apply at least 4 weeks before your expiry date to avoid any gaps.

What you need for renewal

Enhanced DBS certificate

Must be dated within last 6 months OR be subscribed to DBS Update Service

Apply for new DBS check ‚Üí

Medical certificate (if due)

Under 65: Required every 5 years

Over 65: Required annually

Must be on council-approved form and less than 3 months old

DVLA driving licence check consent

You'll need to provide consent for the council to check your DVLA record

Safeguarding training (if due)

Required every 3 years - check your licence to see when yours is due

Renewal fee

See fees and charges for current renewal fees. Payment is required in full when submitting your application.

Renew online via My Gloucester ‚Üí

‚ùì Frequently Asked Questions

How long does a driver licence last?

New licences: 3 years from date of issue

Renewal licences: 3 years from expiry date of previous licence

The expiry date is printed on your badge. You should apply to renew at least 4 weeks before it expires.

Can I drive in other areas with my Gloucester licence?

For work in Gloucester: To operate in Gloucester, you need a Gloucester driver licence, the vehicle must be licensed by Gloucester, and you must work through a Gloucester-licensed operator.

For work in other areas: Different councils have different policies on accepting driver licences from other authorities. Contact the licensing team of the area you want to work in to confirm their requirements.

Cross-border hiring

The rules around working across council boundaries are complex. For specific advice on your situation, contact the Gloucester licensing team.

What if I get points on my DVLA licence?
‚ö†Ô∏è
You must notify the council within 48 hours of receiving any convictions, cautions, warnings, or penalty points on your DVLA licence. Failure to do so is a breach of your licence conditions.

The council will assess whether the conviction affects your fitness to hold a taxi licence based on the seriousness and nature of the offence.

Can I work for Uber or other app-based companies?

Yes, but you'll need:

  • Private hire driver licence from Gloucester
  • Vehicle licensed as private hire by Gloucester
  • The operator (e.g. Uber) must hold an operator licence from Gloucester

Important: All three licences must be from the same authority (Gloucester) if you're operating in Gloucester.

What's the difference between hackney carriage and private hire drivers?

Hackney Carriage Driver

You CAN:

  • Be hailed in the street
  • Wait at taxi ranks
  • Accept pre-bookings
  • Use a taximeter

Private Hire Driver

You CANNOT:

  • Accept street hailing (uninsured if you do)
  • Wait or tout for business
  • Wait at taxi ranks (criminal offence)
  • Display 'taxi' or 'cab' signage

You MUST: Only accept jobs from a licensed operator

Do I need to notify the council of address changes?

Yes. You must notify the licensing team in writing within 7 days of:

  • Change of address
  • Change of contact details
  • Any convictions, cautions, or penalty points
  • Any change in medical fitness

Email: licensing@gloucester.gov.uk

What happens if I'm refused a licence?

If your application is refused, you'll receive a written decision explaining why.

Your right to appeal: You can appeal the decision to the Magistrates' Court within 21 days of receiving the refusal notice.

NR3 database: Refusals and revocations are recorded on the National Register for 11 years and shared with other licensing authorities.
